intro: Macradenia mutica, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, velvety leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, often reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its flowers are usually violet or blue in color, with five petals and a prominent corona. Macradenia mutica is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
